snippet: Cheyanne Smith, a high school senior, zigzags around the country advocating laws that protect young people from being pushed into low-wage work or the criminal justice system.
abstract: New York is city of unofficial mayors, with every block, industry, underworld and dog park having its one eminent personality; profile of Cheyanne Smith, student at the Bushwick School for Social Justice in Brooklyn; high school senior zigzags around the country to rallies and conferences advocating laws that prohibit racial profiling and that protect young people from being pushed into low-wage work or the criminal justice system.
lead_paragraph: Cheyanne Smith, a high school senior, zigzags around the country advocating laws that protect young people from being pushed into low-wage work or the criminal justice system.

headline.main: A Mover and Shaker for Youths’ Rights
headline.print_headline: A Mover and Shaker For Youths’ Rights
